str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pray, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to wish; by implication, to pray to God.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing cursed. From anatithemai; a ban or excommunicated.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Akin to, related; subst: fellow countryman, kinsman. From sun and genos; a relative; by extension, a fellow countryman.
